Created an attachment (id=8744)
Eclipse un-usable after a graphic disposed error

After playing with eclipse for a couple of seconds, this is what Eclipse looked
like. Very unusable, I actually lost changes because I didn't know how to save
the changes.
*** Bug 55563 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I found a way to reliably reproduce this on windows.  

1) Open the compare editor from the synchronize view
2) Open a previous revision of the file from the CVS Resource History view
3) Close the previous revision
4) The compare editor has gone bad
MVM and I have verified these steps do the same for us.

Fixed the Team code. Can't reproduce with these steps anymore. Question remains
though: how can a disposed image bring down the entire workbench? Moving to UI
for comment.

The issue is the way that paint works in a tab folder. If anyone were to 
protect against this it would be SWT
Fixed as a result of teams fixes.
*** Bug 55792 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
